column2: ENGLISH

I can feel their eyes upon me everywhere I go: disappointment, despise. I gathered my vassals and, upon my honor, pledged peace for my realm. Now, I've broken that pledge. My reasons be damned: they won't listen, and my reputation amongst them and the greater realm will suffer for my trespass.
I suppose that's the price I must pay.

Thanks in part to my own efforts, the majority of the population in [emf_province.GetName] has finally begun to adopt the customs and language of my native culture. This will make it easier to manage [emf_province.GetName] and allow it to enjoy higher tax and military efficiency.
Excellent! Eventually, the world will speak [Root.Culture.GetName]...
While I appreciate the world's many cultures, this will serve me.
Your time and effort spent upon converting a province to the [Root.Religion.GetName] Faith has taught you a thing or two along the way.

Pledge Peace to My Vassals

[This.GetTitledFirstName] commits to no offensive war for §Y15§! years. In return, [This.GetSubjectPronoun] will appreciate significantly improved vassal opinion and a strong liege levy boost for the pledge's duration. [This.GetSubjectPronounCap] will face a penalty if [This.GetPossPronoun] pledge is canceled prematurely, but it may nevertheless be canceled within §Y1§! year if [This.GetSubjectPronoun] absolutely must go to war.

§MNOTE:§! Participating in a faction revolt doesn't break the pledge UNLESS leading the rebellion. Likewise, joining wars as an ally does NOT break the pledge.
Reign in Peace for 10 Years
[This.GetTitledFirstName] desires ten years of peace for his realm.
Has ruled in peace for §Y10§! years.
Reign for 20 Years
[This.GetTitledFirstName] yearns to rule for twenty years.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to see the authority of the §Y[Root.Religion.GetName]§! Religion strengthened, as it is currently below §Y30%§!.

To complete the ambition you need to perform §Y3§! of the following tasks:
 §Y*§! Win a Holy War
 §Y*§! Successfully defend against a Holy War
 §Y*§! Construct a Temple
 §Y*§! Convert a Province to [This.Religion.GetName]

Note that you can complete the same task multiple times.

Tasks currently completed: §G[This.strengthen_religion.GetValue]§!
column3:
Pour compléter l'ambition, vous devez exécuter §Y3§! des tâches suivantes:
§Y*§! Gagner une guerre sainte
§Y*§! Se défendre avec succès contre une guerre sainte
§Y*§! Construire un temple
§Y*§! Convertir un comté à la religion [This.Religion.GetName] 

Notez que vous pouvez accomplir la même tâche plusieurs fois.

Les tâches actuellement terminées: §G[This.strengthen_religion.GetValue]§!
column4:
Um diese Ambition zu erfüllen, müsst Ihr §Y3§! der folgenden Aufgaben ausführen:
 §Y*§! Einen Heiligen Krieg gewinnen
 §Y*§! Erfolgreich einen Heiligen Krieg verteidigen
 §Y*§! Einen Tempel bauen
 §Y*§! Eine Provinz zu [This.Religion.GetName] konvertieren

Beachte, dass die gleiche Aufgabe mehrmals erfüllt werden kann.

Momentan abgeschlossen: §G[This.strengthen_religion.GetValue]§!
column6:
Para cumplir esta ambición debes realizar §Y3§! de las tareas siguientes:
 §Y*§! Ganar una Guerra santa
 §Y*§! Defenderte exitosamente contra una Guerra santa
 §Y*§! Construir un templo
 §Y*§! Convertir una provincia al [This.Religion.GetName]

Observa que puedes cumplir la misma tarea varias veces.

Tareas completadas actualmente: §G[This.strengthen_religion.GetValue]§!

column2: Live to Old Age
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to live a long and fulfilling life.
Live to Elderly Age
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to keep living, even though death approaches soon.
Old Age
Elderly

Some of my courtiers believe that due to my old age, I shouldn’t go hunting as much as I used to. Why do people keep insisting I restrain myself? I think I’m old and wise enough to make my own decisions, right?
I’ll be fine, fools!
Perhaps I really should cut down on my hunting.
I'll just make sure I won’t exert myself as much while hunting.
Undoubtedly [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will ensure I will not be harmed.

The young men and women these days bother me - they don’t seem to have the same respectable, moral behavior I had when I was growing up. They listen to unsavory music, sit and walk in promiscuous ways, talk with vulgar terms, ignore the wisdom of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]... what has this world come to?
I wasn’t an angel myself years ago. They’ll improve with time.
They don’t understand the hardships I had to go through!
I pray that [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will give them strength and wisdom.
Silly kids. They’re hopeless, useless imbeciles.

Being so old, you know that your death is near - a matter of if, not when. Because of this, thoughts of the afterlife have preoccupied you for a while. What if you don’t end up with a good afterlife? A fearful possibility, indeed.
Pray that [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will help me.
It doesn’t matter either way.
I’ve lived a good life - what’s there to fear?

Although I generally understand the [Root.Culture.GetName] the younger men and women speak, sometimes, they use exotic and foreign words that I simply don’t understand. The younger people simply tell me that I am too old to understand all this new vocabulary.
I should make an effort to understand these new words!
I should worry about more pressing matters.

As you grow older and older, your body gets weaker and weaker. The last few weeks have been particularly rough on you. You figure that your workload is causing you a lot of unnecessary stress, exhausting you and draining what energy you have.
What? It’s’ nothing.
At this rate, I think I’ll get sick...
I’ll just have to work harder!
I’ll try to get some help from others...

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has had more than ten years of undisturbed peace. Memories of war and battles are fading away, and vassals and courtiers are devoting themselves more and more to administration, politics and plotting, rather than to martial duties.
May this land never suffer the cruelty of war again.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has had more than fifteen years of undisturbed peace. Memories of war and battles are fading away, and vassals and courtiers are devoting themselves more and more to administration, politics and plotting, rather than to martial duties.
May this land never suffer the cruelty of war again.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has had more than twenty years of undisturbed peace. Memories of war and battles are fading away, and vassals and courtiers are devoting themselves more and more to administration, politics and plotting, rather than to martial duties.
May this land never suffer the cruelty of war again.
